**Edited <time datetime="2016-05-06T19:21:12Z" title="05/06/2016 07:21  PM" data-short="8 yr">May 6, 2016</time> by Ziw**

Tried out the part pack you suggested, and while the leaps aren't as powerful as they were before, the vessel is still flipped over.

Tried looking at the debug menu, but I'm [not certain if it is too helpful.](https://www.dropbox.com/s/f3a5b6ict8a6yn8/Screenshot%202016-05-06%2014.41.37.png?dl=0)

Think I'll wait on resuming my particular rover centric experiments until the issue is fixed.

> 49 minutes ago, WildLynx said:
> 
> 
> Was digging KSP.log to catch something edible and found this:
> 
> 
> 
> 
>     
>     
>     [LOG 23:31:25.055] PartLoader: Compiling Part 'MagicSmokeIndustries/Parts/Legacy/IR_Gantry/partVariant/GantryLargeScaleableVariant'
>     [ERR 23:31:25.070] Invalid float value! Field electricChargeRequired, value 0.5,1.0,2.0 on object of type InfernalRobotics.Module.MuMechToggle
>     
> 
> 
> 
> 
> And the main reason I was parsing that file:
> 
> 
> 
> 
>     
>     
>     [ERR 23:33:30.182] [Toolbar] [ERROR] button texture not found: MagicSmokeIndustries/blizzy_icon
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Blizzy toolbar shos IR icon as solid pink, and I was looking for a error that causes it.
> 

oops, the icon somehow slipped through the cracks

Will reupload the zip file on github and update the Curse zip later when we release 2.0.3

Edit: reuploaded the 2.0.2 on github, now it contains the icon

**Edited <time datetime="2016-05-07T22:03:00Z" title="05/07/2016 10:03  PM" data-short="8 yr">May 7, 2016</time> by Ziw**

Apologies folks, but I am legit a little dense.  I read the OP, I read through the last few pages of this thread, and I did a keyword search through the thread for "legacy."  I'm not entirely clear on what is in the Legacy Parts download and what's in the main download.  I see in the OP there's the rework video... are there parts that haven't been reworked *yet*, or won't *ever* be reworked, or...?

As in, could the OP be updated with actual lists and / or imgur pics of parts in each?  (Possibly concealed by spoiler tags, of course.)

> 
>

> 
> 
> Apologies folks, but I am legit a little dense.  I read the OP, I read through the last few pages of this thread, and I did a keyword search through the thread for "legacy."  I'm not entirely clear on what is in the Legacy Parts download and what's in the main download.  I see in the OP there's the rework video... are there parts that haven't been reworked *yet*, or won't *ever* be reworked, or...?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> As in, could the OP be updated with actual lists and / or imgur pics of parts in each?  (Possibly concealed by spoiler tags, of course.)
> 

Our Full zip includes old (dark) parts, and reworked parts by Zodius (white) could be found in the last link on my signature.

can someone help me? I use infernal robotics for at least half of my crafts and whenever I use bilateral symmetry, each half goes in the opposite direction with action groups.

> 
> 
> 4 minutes ago, boomchacle said:
> 
> 
> can someone help me? I use infernal robotics for at least half of my crafts and whenever I use bilateral symmetry, each half goes in the opposite direction with action groups.
> 

You mean moving with action groups differs from moving using UI? You know you can invert movement direction on a per servo basis?

> 
> 
> Just now, Ziw said:
> 
> 
> You mean moving with action groups differs from moving using UI? You know you can invert movement direction on a per servo basis?
> 

really? how?

>

> 
> 
> You mean moving with action groups differs from moving using UI? You know you can invert movement direction on a per servo basis?
> 

nvm I see it

>

> 
> 
> [@kujuman](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/28299-kujuman/) or anyone else experiencing wheel jitter - please try this dll (replace your existing InfernalRobotics.dll with this one), it uses a different approach for auto-strut removal and re-creation.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [https://mega.nz/#!ud1jRCaR!bwnIRog24Hc-PUOrhvN8bTB6o0RK37E4antzMnuTdgM](https://mega.nz/#!ud1jRCaR!bwnIRog24Hc-PUOrhvN8bTB6o0RK37E4antzMnuTdgM)

>

> This version seemed to fix the issue for me. I can still upload the previously troublesome craft if you'd like.

Good, will post an update with this fix then.

I got some issues posted there, some of the problems could be related to this mod, too:

<iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/47786-11ish-near-future-technologies-april-22-updates/&do=embed&embedComment=2570929&embedDo=findComment&page=243#comment-2570929"></iframe>

The quote got messed up . . . this was originally about the weak legs during physics warp.

Quantum struts solved that problem.  Plus I switched to just using the legs to keep the craft from falling over. 

I ran into a different problem though.  I left the game one evening, when I loaded it the next, the landing gear parts had collapsed in one dimension (x or y?), the hinges were disassembled, and if I tried to articulate them they rotated from the center, not the ends.  The first time I loaded the game the part of the hinges attached to the craft were still there, but on my second load (this morning, to take screen shots) those had vanished (probably inside the ship now).  This is with version 2.0.1.

In the VAB (legs extended):

![26847192021_37579c7b3f_b.jpg](https://c2.staticflickr.com/8/7582/26847192021_37579c7b3f_b.jpg)

What it looked like on the last load (legs weren't extended -- I should get a better pair of screen shots, but no time right now):

![26847187311_c4ce930316.jpg](https://c2.staticflickr.com/8/7459/26847187311_c4ce930316.jpg)
